column4: does anyone know what to do if you don't get your laptops touchpad recognized automatically? i also tried connecting a ps/2 one but i doesn't get automatically recognized either. i got to remove it and plug it back in...
I told you more then an hour ago "apt-cache search touchpad"... you would have seen tpconfig... touchpad config... try it...
yes, use alien though to create .deb's from the .rpm
probably, I'd install it anyways, won't do you any harm...
dpkg-reconfigure debconf > set to low priority... then dpkg-reconfigure tpconfig, more to config though... then reconfigure debconf back to high...
you can apply patches and recompile your kernel... if you can't follow http://compass.com/synaptics/ though, then I can't be of help  :(
if it seems too complicated etc...
recompiling a kernel isn't really easy enless you know your hardware... but its the only way to get your touchpad working currently... its up to you  :(
